channel.title: Plugin 'SML' failed to load because module 'SML' could not be found
channel.description:
So I'm testing this new mod, and manually installed SML following the instructions from https://docs.ficsit.app/satisfactory-modding/latest/ManualInstallDirections.html
Extracted SML to `<game root>/FactoryGame/Mods` now has '/FactoryGame/Mods/SML' Placed my mod to /FactoryGame/Mods/*.smod*
After that I'm gettin' an error that says: Plugin 'SML' failed to load because module 'SML' could not be found. Please ensure the plugin is properly installed, otherwise consider disabling the plugin for this project.
Still with the same message without my mod. Am I missing something here?

item.title: Plugin 'SML' failed to load because module 'SML' could not be found
item.dc:creator: @Lagunist Lagunist
item.description:
@Lagunist wrote:

I just had to do a fresh install of both Satisfactory and SMM, and I also am getting the same message with only “compatible” mods loaded.

Read full topic
item.source: Plugin 'SML' failed to load because module 'SML' could not be found

item.title: Plugin 'SML' failed to load because module 'SML' could not be found
item.dc:creator: @KodiakGhost Kodiak Ghost
item.description:
@KodiakGhost wrote:

So after looking through all the replies and trying a few things it seems that a few assumptions are made for various people. For those that are not a technically minded as most here is what you do until they automatically update with the fix.

Go to your FactoryGame folder for your game, open ‘Mods’, open one at a time the mods you have in there and repeat the following: Open Binaries>Win64, open the UE4-Win64-Shipping.modules using Notepad (I use Notepad++ but basic Notepad should work). Change the buildID number listed there to 151248 and save the file. If the mods does not require a Binaries folder you do not need to change anything.

The mods should now work and the game will launch without an error message

Read full topic

item.source: Plugin 'SML' failed to load because module 'SML' could not be found

item.title: Plugin 'SML' failed to load because module 'SML' could not be found
item.dc:creator: @mircearoata Mircearoata
item.description:
@mircearoata wrote:

Don’t do that! Don’t modify game files like this! SML is a plugin, and it should stay a plugin! This change causes many other problems that we spent hours on the modding discord with 3 people who we just now found they did this, trying to understand what was going on!
Just use the correct SMM version (v2.4.3 for Early Access and v2.4.4 for Experimental)

Also @Thomas_Fiedler

Read full topic

item.title: Plugin 'SML' failed to load because module 'SML' could not be found
item.dc:creator: @Roland_Baron Roland Baron
item.description:
@Roland_Baron wrote:

Make sure to add the comma at the end of the previous last line. Took me an hour to figure that out. LoL

Works like a charm now.

Thanks.

item.title: Plugin 'SML' failed to load because module 'SML' could not be found
item.dc:creator: @Olofasenius Olofasenius
item.description:
@Olofasenius wrote:

Check the BuildID in the SML-binaries, it should match the buildID from the usual binaries

Mods\SML\Binaries\Win64 -> UE4-Win64-Shipping.modules -> open with notes and check the buildID, as of right now 151248 works for me there

Read full topic

item.source: Plugin 'SML' failed to load because module 'SML' could not be found

item.title: Plugin 'SML' failed to load because module 'SML' could not be found
item.dc:creator: @sandamn2036 Sandamn2036
item.description:
@sandamn2036 wrote:

When you modify UE4-Win64-Shipping.modules you have to properly for mat it as json. Here is a copy of mine that is working.

{
“BuildId”: “151248”,
“Modules”:
{
“CoffeeCore”: “UE4-CoffeeCore-Win64-Shipping.dll”,
“FactoryGame”: “UE4-FactoryGame-Win64-Shipping.dll”,
“GameAnalyticsModule”: “UE4-GameAnalyticsModule-Win64-Shipping.dll”,
“SML”: “UE4-SML-Win64-Shipping.dll”
}
}

Hope this helps. Happy modding.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Joshua_Miles Joshua Miles
item.description:
@Joshua_Miles wrote:

Thomas_Fiedler:

Then i copied the SML binaries (*.dll, *.pdb) from
…\Satisfactory\FactoryGame\Mods\SML\Binaries\Win64
To
…\Satisfactory\FactoryGame\Binaries\Win64

After that i modified the file
UE4-Win64-Shipping.modules
and add the SML Modul
“SML”: “UE4-SML-Win64-Shipping.dll”

tried that and then it failed to locate the “factorygame” module. I’m just going to uninstall SMM at this point until this is fixed because I can’t even launch the game through steam anymore.

item.source: Plugin 'SML' failed to load because module 'SML' could not be found

item.title: Plugin 'SML' failed to load because module 'SML' could not be found
item.dc:creator: @Thomas_Fiedler Thomas Fiedler
item.description:
@Thomas_Fiedler wrote:

Thomas_Fiedler:

Mods\SML\Binaries\Win64

The files i metioned, will be copied to this location, after you install and activate SMM, with the SML v3.0.0.

Also you can find these files in the application path of the SMM.
…SatisfactoryModManager\downloadCache\smlVersions\3.0.0\SML\Binaries\Win64

For Steam you can find the application path in the settings/downloads/steam library paths.
For Epic you handled the application path during the installation process.

Read full topic

item.source: Plugin 'SML' failed to load because module 'SML' could not be found

item.title: Plugin 'SML' failed to load because module 'SML' could not be found
item.dc:creator: @Thomas_Fiedler Thomas Fiedler
item.description:
@Thomas_Fiedler wrote:

Hi,
i found way to solve the problem for me.
After installing SMM and the mods i want, i get the same error message.
CL151248 SML v3.0.0

Then i copied the SML binaries (*.dll, *.pdb) from
…\Satisfactory\FactoryGame\Mods\SML\Binaries\Win64
To
…\Satisfactory\FactoryGame\Binaries\Win64

After that i modified the file
UE4-Win64-Shipping.modules
and add the SML Modul
“SML”: “UE4-SML-Win64-Shipping.dll”

Cheers

Read full topic
